publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-2933 David Whitton: On Their Bikes in St Matthew’s Primary School—That the Parliament congratulates, and recognises the achievements of, St Matthew’s Primary School in Bishopbriggs for being one of the first schools in Scotland to set up a cycle train where children on bikes are escorted by volunteer rangers along a safe route to and from school; notes that the trains run every day and take the children to and from school, picking up and dropping off at their homes, and recognises the backing of East Dunbartonshire Council, Sustrans, Cycling Scotland, Strathclyde Police, Strathclyde Fire and Rescue and local firms Solid Rock Cycles and Viewfield Galleries.

S3M-2933 David Whitton: On Their Bikes in St Matthew’s Primary School—That the Parliament congratulates, and recognises the achievements of, St Matthew’s Primary School in Bishopbriggs for being one of the first schools in Scotland to set up a cycle train where children on bikes are escorted by volunteer rangers along a safe route to and from school; notes that the trains run every day and take the children to and from school, picking up and dropping off at their homes, and recognises the backing of East Dunbartonshire Council, Sustrans, Cycling Scotland, Strathclyde Police, Strathclyde Fire and Rescue and local firms Solid Rock Cycles and Viewfield Galleries.
S3M-2933 On Their Bikes in St Matthew’s Primary School (lodged on 20 November 2008) Karen Whitefield*
